remarks: The predicate " ` F ` is a continuous function from topology ` J ` to topology ` K ` at point ` P ` ." in terms of neighborhoods. (Contributed by FL, 18-Jul-2011.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
statement:
iscnp4 $p |- ( ( J e. ( TopOn ` X ) /\ K e. ( TopOn ` Y ) /\ P e. X ) -> ( F e. ( ( J CnP K ) ` P ) <-> ( F : X --> Y /\ A. y e. ( ( nei ` K ) ` { ( F ` P ) } ) E. x e. ( ( nei ` J ) ` { P } ) ( F " x ) C_ y ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
